intro: Tithymalus inderiensis, commonly known as the Inderiense tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and marshy areas. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers bloom in clusters, producing small, yellowish-orange petals that attract various pollinators.
